subject: Creativity
title: Pixar's Ed Catmull: Building a Culture Where Creativity Thrives
description: A quick, practical guide to Pixar's Ed Catmull: Building a Culture Where Creativity Thrives.

hook.text: Every Pixar movie starts bad. Catmull says so himself. The job of creative leadership isn't to prevent bad ideas â€” it's.

buildup.text: Catmull's Braintrust: directors present rough cuts, and peers give brutally honest feedback.

discovery.text: This separates feedback from power. People give honest opinions because they can't force changes.

twist.text: Catmull's biggest lesson: success is more dangerous than failure. After Toy Story, complacency nearly killed Pixar.

climax.text: Pixar has made 27 films with 96%+ average Rotten Tomatoes score. No other studio comes close.

punchline.text: Creative leadership isn't choosing the best idea.

quiz.question: What is the key rule of Pixar's Braintrust feedback sessions?
options: Peers give honest feedback but the director has final say
